Description: Size of a cache block (contiguous, naturally aligned memory range, power-of-two or NAPOT)
Constraints: Must be a contiguous, naturally aligned power-of-two (NAPOT) range; must be uniform throughout the system for CMO extensions.
Keywords: uniform, power-of-two, implementation-defined, shall be uniform, NAPOT, shall, implementation-specific

Description: Total capacity of a cache in bytes or blocks
Constraints: None explicitly mentioned

Description: Internal structure and configuration of a cache (e.g., associativity, ways, sets)
Constraints: None explicitly mentioned

Description: The method provided by the execution environment for software to identify cache parameters
Constraints: The execution environment must provide such a mechanism (implied requirement)
Keywords: software a means to discover, provides

Description: Whether cache block sizes are uniform across the system (applies to initial CMO extensions)
Constraints: Cache block size shall be uniform
Keywords: uniform throughout the system, shall, initial set of CMO extensions

Description: Total capacity and internal organization (e.g., associativity, number of sets) of a cache
Constraints: None explicitly stated beyond being implementation-specific

Description: Mechanism to discover information about caches and cache blocks
Encoding of read/write accessibility of CSRs by privilege level
Constraints: Upper 4 bits of CSR address encode accessibility; top two bits indicate read/write or read-only
Keywords: conventional, may, by convention, according to privilege level

Description: Size of the CSR address encoding space
Constraints: 12-bit encoding space for up to 4,096 CSRs

Description: Determines the privilege level encoding for CSR access (e.g., User, Supervisor, Machine). The standard ISA uses csr[9:8] for this purpose.
Constraints: - Encoded in bits csr[9:8] of the CSR address. - Defines the lowest privilege level allowed to access the CSR. - May vary or be extended in future revisions.
Keywords: lowest privilege level, CSR, encode, convention, privilege level, access, encoding

Description: Indicates whether a CSR is read-only (11) or read/write (00, 01, or 10). Encoded in the top two bits (csr[11:10]) of the CSR address.
Constraints: - Read-only if csr[11:10] = 11. - Read/write if csr[11:10] = 00, 01, or 10. - Follows standard ISA conventions (may be modified in extensions).

Description: Width of the CSR address encoding field.
Constraints: Fixed at 12 bits, allowing up to 4096 CSRs

Description: Encoding of read/write accessibility using the top two bits of the CSR address.
Constraints: Encodes read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11)

Description: Encoding of the lowest privilege level that can access a CSR using bits [9:8].
Constraints: Uses 2 bits to specify the minimal privilege level
Keywords: lowest privilege level, next two bits

Description: Encoding of CSR read/write accessibility and minimum privilege level using upper bits of the 12-bit CSR address
Constraints: Uses bits csr[11:8]; csr[11:10] encodes R/W mode (00, 01, 10 = read/write; 11 = read-only); csr[9:8] encodes lowest privilege level allowed to access the CSR
Keywords: according to, convention, as shown in Table 1

Description: Encoding space for Control and Status Registers (CSRs)
Constraints: 12-bit encoding space for up to 4,096 CSRs

Description: Encoding of the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
Constraints: Encoded in bits csr[9:8]

Description: Encoding of read/write accessibility of CSRs based on privilege level
Constraints: None specified

Description: Indicator for read/write or read-only status of CSR
Constraints: None specified

Description: Privilege levels that can read and write CSRs
Constraints: Determined by csr_accessibility encoding

Description: Privilege levels that can only read CSRs
Constraints: Determined by csr_accessibility encoding

Description: The use of the upper 4 bits of the CSR address (csr[11:8]) to encode read/write accessibility and privilege level.
Constraints: Follows the mapping where csr[11:10] indicates R/W status and csr[9:8] indicates minimum privilege level.

Description: Determination of whether a CSR is read/write or read-only based on the top two bits of its address.
Constraints: Bits 00, 01, or 10 indicate read/write; bit 11 indicates read-only.

Description: The lowest privilege level required to access a specific CSR address.
Constraints: Encoded in bits csr[9:8] of the CSR address.

Description: The size of the encoding space reserved for CSRs.
Constraints: 12-bit encoding space (up to 4,096 CSRs)

Description: The conventional use of the upper 4 bits of the CSR address to encode read/write accessibility and privilege level.
Constraints: csr[11:8] for accessibility and privilege, csr[11:10] for read/write vs. read-only, csr[9:8] for lowest privilege level.
Keywords: are used to encode, By convention

Description: Width of the CSR address space in bits
Constraints: None

Description: Number of bits used to encode CSR accessibility
Constraints: 4 bits

Description: Number of bits used to encode CSR read and write accessibility
Constraints: 2 bits

Description: Number of bits used to encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
Constraints: 2 bits

Description: Encoding values for read and write accessibility of CSRs
Defines the read/write accessibility of Control and Status Registers (CSRs) based on privilege level (e.g., User, Supervisor, Machine).
Constraints: - Encoded in the upper 4 bits of the CSR address (csr[11:8]). - Follows "conventional" R/W accessibility rules per Table 1. - Top two bits (csr[11:10]) determine if CSR is read/write (00, 01, or 10) or read-only (11). - Next two bits (csr[9:8]) encode the lowest privilege level allowed to access the CSR.
Keywords: conventional, accessibility, CSRs, may, privilege level, by convention

Description: Specifies the size of the encoding space reserved for CSRs in the RISC-V ISA. Currently set to 12 bits (csr[11:0]), allowing up to 4,096 CSRs.
Constraints: - Currently fixed at 12 bits (csr[11:0]) in the standard ISA. - Allows up to 4,096 CSRs (2^12). - Address space may be expanded or reduced in future revisions or extensions.
Keywords: up to, CSRs, sets aside, by convention, encoding space

Description: Defines which privilege levels (User, Supervisor, Machine) are supported for CSR access. Implementation-specific beyond the standard ISA conventions.
Constraints: - Must align with the encoding rules in csr[9:8] and csr[11:10]. - May include additional levels (e.g., Hypervisor) in extensions. - Not explicitly limited in the standard ISA but constrained by convention.
Keywords: CSR, convention, may, privilege level, supported, access
